google_play_reviews.content: Cool code, kudos.

This app out of date. It does not work on my OnePlus 8, or my OnePlus Nord 20 and OnePlus 10 Pro. So, its definitely an issue for OnePlus users. The icon will not appear in the notification bar and even if it is still working for other phones it STILL needs to be updated and should be done on a regular basis for all android releases for security and performance purposes.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm using Android 12 and it works fine.

google_play_reviews.content: The app works but the notification for the frequency is not working right. It shows the frequency for one CPU, then shows the frequency for the other CPU within the same notification. I constantly switches back and forth between the two for some reason. I wish it would show the frequency and load for both CPU's instead of looking at cores 1-4.

*Update: after upgrading to Android 13, the monochrome is gone, back to full colors. Excellent!* Great, easy way to monitor the primary functions of the CPU. New update color is horrid (thanks a lot, Google), but still 5 stars. I reverted to the previous version.

I love the simplicity. I only wish some things work better: 1. In landscape, the wrench icon for settings is not visible. 2. I would like an option to see true CPU usage (old behavior) on selinux disabled devices. This used to work until, I think, you updated to respect Android 8+ restrictions. Or even better: implement a root function to access the data. This could work with selinux enabled. Cheers!

So glad that this tool is still being updated. Such a small tool but so useful. Have been using this for years. Simple and does what I need it to.
The CPU load indicator does not work on Samsung android 10, which is a pity, as the other three functions work ok, again disappointing as otherwise I like this app.
The best cpu monitor hands down.....pls update more frequently!
Nice for no ads. But ny Samsung Galaxy Tab S3 always shows 100% for the first two cores and 71% for the other two, no matter what else is running.

I LOVE THIS APP. PLEASE MAKE PREMIUM VERSION SO I CAN PAY YOU!!!! Works great on realme GT G5, but phone defaults it to silent notifications. You have to manually change it to alerting to get CPU to show in status bar. Also, the cpu meter in the status bar is white on a Motorola 5G ace, Pixels, but shows in color on the realms GT 5G. I don't know why. All running Android 11.
Great App. Can you make a similar app for RAM stats?
Wigit Would Be, But Whole.
I love this app, it gives me just exactly what I want.

+It's the only cpu display app I could find that doesn't have ads. -The display updates don't happen anywhere near the intervals selected in the settings. They're usually much slower and sometimes stop all together. Also I don't think they're accurate. When I have a computation app (Boinc) running it displays between 65% and 100%. It should be always around 100%. I'm running Android 9.

Shows CPU usage, and nothing else (like ads). Works great.

Shows CPU usage based on frequency, as total and for individual cores. Interval can be customized. An additional graphical chart would be nice for a better overview of CPU usage during a given period of time.

This is 'A' damn fantastic realtime CPU monitor I've used on Android approx. ish closing in on 10~ yrs. As a suggestion, try including OSD graphs displaying the usage amount of system RAM, GPU and only, if possible... being able to see the return of the vivid CPU gradient graphs! Loved it! I'd also suggest implementing a colour palette so users can personalise them via their OSD top drawer. It will help easily distinguish monitored component(s) apart reducing potential confusion. üòÅüòâüëåüëç
Finally! Finally an update! :)
Awesome app that tracks usage of all cores

It's does the job extremelly well, but i wich it had more options about the polling rate, don't get me wrong 0.5 sec is quite good but some rare times you might need more options for like 0.01 sec so you can monitor, for example governors' behavior when it comes to configuring a cpu. Still a very well made app none the less!
no consume datos
Very useful and simple. I need RAM version of this app.

Works, but will not exit when asked. Have to uninstall.
Can we have the colours back please?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, no. its the rule of the store. Thanks.

google_play_reviews.content: CPU LOAD in the STATUS BAR. That's what i wanted. Thanks!

It would be great if you mentioned in the description that cpu usage monitoring only works on Android 7 or earlier and on rooted devices. CPU frequency does *not* correctly represents CPU usage especially for long CPU intensive operations where the SOC needs to downclock to adhere to thermal limits - in this case the user might be misled that e.g. CPU frequency is just 50% of its maximum while in reality the user device is under big stress.
My go-to CPU monitor app for my phone since it takes up very little screen space and has a good UI. I just wish it had a good task manager built in. Bring back the color status bar icon!
very good

Thanks for the latest update :-). Even though I miss the previously coloured, load indicating bars in the app's status/info bar icon, having CPU Stats there, for the first time on my Android 8.1 phone, display the current CPU usage, just like I was used to on my previous A4.4 one, is marvelous. But I do miss the lack of colour ;-)

Doesn't seem to support Android 9? Updated: Using version 2.1.2, All of the top 4 cores stuck at 13% as the bottom ZEROED OUT POSITION before moving. All bottom 4 cores stuck at 23% as the bottom ZEROED OUT POSITION before moving. LG V30 running Android 9 Pie. Also Restarted after applying settings for 1 second intervals. Still a "no go".

google_play_reviews.content: It works great but I don't like that you took away the colors in the icon bar at all!

google_play_reviews.content: Actually unbelievably accurate. And always right there. Requires no babysitting. only not so good anymore due to restrictions. what happened to android? it is becoming something like what i dont want

bring back color notification icon. excellent open source app .

Stopped Working. Uninstalled. Will try a reinstall. Reinstall did not work. App closes every time and or crashes. I have an 8-core at 1.7/2.8 gigahertz processor so not an older smart phone. 845 Snapdragon. Reinstalled app closes. Used to work on this LG G7 Thinq.

Also had this tool for ages. I remember F-Droid version using monochrome icons, too, so I went back to this one. Now no color so I downgraded. You say it's Google's fault. Fine. I suggest a really separate F-Droid version allowing the user to choose between color and monochrome. Otherwise, I'll stick with 2.0.2 and be done with it.
Nice job

Using a lot of CPU while phone is asleep. Neat, really been wanting a simple cpu monitor for android.
